text:
1. The documentation of the optional task "Microsoft Visual SourceSafe Tasks 
User Manual" for the vsscheckout task has the parameter "writable", but when i 
set 

   writable="true"

i get the error:

 [vsscheckout] BUILD FAILED: file:D:/data/mpj/build.xml:363: The <vsscheckout> 
task doesn't support the "writable" attribute.


2. if i remove the writable parameter, the ant task hangs forever.
creator: mhilpert@gmx.de
antoine@apache.org
text:
Sounds like there is a discrepancy between the documentation and the actual 
vsscheckout implementation in ant 1.5.3

The answer is : the writable attribute does not exist in ant 1.5.3.

The writable attribute got added in MSVSSCHECKOUT.java version 1.16, 2003/04/15 
04:26:51 

ant 1.5.3 has this revision of MSVSSCHECKOUT.java :  1.8.2.3 , Mon Feb 10 14:25:
20 2003 

If you need the writable attribute, then you need ant1.6alpha.

Otherwise, the real problem is probably : why does your vsscheckout hang for 
ever ?

Do you have ss.exe in your path ? Are all your Visual Source Safe parameters set 
up OK. 

I am closing this bug as WONTFIX (because there might not be other ant versions 
in the ant 1.5 branch after ant 1.5.3).

If you have more problems with the Visual Source Safe tasks, please discuss them 
on the user list before filling in a new bug report.

Cheers,

Antoine
